0.title: Point of Sale
0.description: How to integrate a point of sale (POS) terminal with Centrapay APIs.

1.title: Core Requirements
1.description: Centrapay POS integrations must be able to create, void and refund Payment Requests on behalf of Merchants.

2.title: Optional Protocol Extensions
2.description: Our payment protocol supports several optional extensions. Please review the extensions below and determine which ones you need for your integration.

3.title: Contact Us
3.description: Contact integrations@centrapay.com to get started with API keys.

4.title: Payment Terminal
4.description: How to integrate a payment terminal with Centrapay APIs.

5.title: API Keys
5.description: To create API keys, you first need to get in touch with Centrapay to be issued an Integrator Account and an “Account owner” API key. An “Account owner” is a special kind of role that allows you to manage your account.

6.title: Merchant Configs
6.description: Centrapay Merchant Configs represent an available set of configured payment methods that can be utilized by one or more payment terminals by a Merchant.

7.title: Example Flows
7.description: See Payment Flows for an overview of the API calls required for different payment flows.

8.title: Terminal Interface Guidelines
8.description: When configuring a terminal with Centrapay there are a few common touch points that require branded assets. Please use the Centrapay Brand Assets when building the UI for these screens.

9.title: Displaying a Button
9.description: Illustration of payment terminal displaying Centrapay button

10.title: Displaying an Icon
10.description: Illustration of payment terminal displaying Centrapay icon

11.title: Displaying QR Codes
11.description: Illustration of payment terminal displaying Centrapay QR code

12.title: Integration Architecture
12.description: We strongly recommend Centrapay APIs are invoked from your backend and not directly from your payment terminals. Centralizing the invocation of our APIs from your backend offers the following benefits:

13.title: Mitigating Network Issues
13.description: See the guide on Merchant Integration Error Handling for information on preventing and handling network issues.

14.title: Error Handling
14.description: How to deal with inconsistencies in Payment Request statuses due to network issues or race conditions.

15.title: Respect Payment Status
15.description: Use the Payment Request status as the source of truth when determining if a Payment Request is paid or expired. For example, if cancelling a Payment Request fails with a REQUEST_PAID error then the terminal should respond accordingly; either by showing the transaction as paid or initiating a void instead.

16.title: Void Unknown Status
16.description: If the status of a transaction cannot be determined to be successful after retrying, then the Payment Request should be voided. Voiding a Payment Request will cancel the request and trigger any refunds if necessary.

17.title: Display Error Reasons
17.description:
Centrapay has a limited set of error messages to simplify integration for our third-party partners.
Due to this, the same error message can be returned for different reasons.
Centrapay provides additional details in the reason field to enhance error messages and assist with debugging.
Integrators may choose to display the reason to provide more information to the user, however, it is recommended thatreason is not used to drive application logic.

18.title: Configure POS Timeout
18.description: Payment Requests have a configurable timeout which defaults to 2 minutes. Integrators should make sure that the payment terminal times out 5-10 seconds after the Payment Request.

19.title: Retry Unknown Errors
19.description: When faced with an unknown error while checking the status of a Payment Request, POS integrations should retry at least once before voiding the transaction.

20.title: Resolving Persistent Errors
20.description: For issues that cannot be resolved, please reach out to Centrapay Support at integrations@centrapay.com.

21.title: Line Items
21.description: Line items are used to communicate the details of a purchase to a patron.

22.title: Restrictions
22.description:
Payments via Centrapay can be made against specific line items. This can happen because a user has specifically requested the line items they wish an asset to pay for, or because they were using an asset that can only be redeemed for a specific product, like a Centrapay Token.
It's important to communicate to the merchant which line items have been purchased via Centrapay so they are able to make educated decisions when refunding transactions or completing partial payments.
This information should also be displayed to a consumer when possible. If any line items were purchased by a specific asset, they will be returned on a Payment Request inside the Asset Totals array.
Integrators must iterate through the assetTotals array and display any line items purchased to the merchant. Line items that have been purchased via Centrapay must no longer be able to be purchased using another form of payment.
This is especially important for any assets which are only redeemable against specific line items. For example, there could be a case where someone used a digital token to pay for a line item, and then a physical voucher to pay for that same line item, which would mean the second voucher could go towards purchasing something other than the intended line item.

23.title: Determining Paid For Line Items
23.description:
Payments via Centrapay can be made against specific line items. This can happen because a user has specifically requested the line items they wish an asset to pay for, or because they were using an asset that can only be redeemed for a specific product, like a Centrapay Token.
It's important to communicate to the merchant which line items have been purchased via Centrapay so they are able to make educated decisions when refunding transactions or completing partial payments.
This information should also be displayed to a consumer when possible. If any line items were purchased by a specific asset, they will be returned on a Payment Request inside the Asset Totals array.
Integrators must iterate through the assetTotals array and display any line items purchased to the merchant. Line items that have been purchased via Centrapay must no longer be able to be purchased using another form of payment.
This is especially important for any assets which are only redeemable against specific line items. For example, there could be a case where someone used a digital token to pay for a line item, and then a physical voucher to pay for that same line item, which would mean the second voucher could go towards purchasing something other than the intended line item.

24.title: Farmlands Portal Guide
24.description: Farmlands Co-operative (Farmlands) have partnered with Centrapay Payment Gateway (Centrapay) to deliver a secure web portal for Farmlands Card payments.

25.title: Getting Started
25.description: The initial setup of your Business and all Branches (referred to as Merchants) will be managed by Farmlands. Farmlands will provide Centrapay with the details of a primary Account Owner for the business who will be loaded by Centrapay. Once setup this account owner will be able login and maintain the other members (users) who have or need access to the Account (see Members).

26.title: Business Information
26.description: The initial setup of your Business and all Branches (referred to as Merchants) will be managed by Farmlands. Farmlands will provide Centrapay with the details of a primary Account Owner for the business who will be loaded by Centrapay. Once setup this account owner will be able login and maintain the other members (users) who have or need access to the Account (see Members).

27.title: Registration
27.description: Once the Business and Merchants are set up in the Centrapay Portal, users will receive an email from Farmlands inviting them to register for the portal. Users must use the email address provided in the initial setup process to register.

28.title: Log In
28.description: The Centrapay Business Portal will store your authenticated session for up to 60 days. During this time, it is not necessary to re-authenticate simply enter your email address to log in. After 60 days, you will be prompted to re-authenticate by entering a Verification Code sent to your registered email address.

29.title: Dashboard
29.description: The Dashboard is an overview of Centrapay Business Account and will be your main screen for generating an authorisation or releasing a previous Farmlands Authorisation.

30.title: Farmlands Authorisations
30.description: The Centrapay Business Portal provides a real-time authorisation of a Farmlands Card when presented as payment for the purchase of goods or services. It validates that the Card is active and there is a sufficient available balance to process the transaction.

31.title: Authorisation Responses
31.description:
|          Type          |                                                                                                        Description                                                                                                         |
| ---------------------- | -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| Authorisation Approved | Funds have now been placed on hold onto the customer account, pending the receipt of the Card Partner’s invoice within the agreed period.                                                                                  |
| Pending                | Card Partner creates the request, but the authorisation is not yet complete. This authorisation is not approved.                                                                                                           |
| Check ID               | This response may occur for a high-value sale. This means the transaction is pending authorisation until the Card Partner confirms they have authenticated the customer’s photo ID against the name on the Farmlands Card. |
| Declined               | The authorisation is declined due to an invalid card number, a credit limit exceeded, or Card Partner is unable to verify a high-value transaction. Refer to Farmlands Contact Centre 0800 200 600                         |
| Release                | The funds “on hold” are cancelled by Card Partner. This may occur when a Card Partner is unable to fulfil an order. (This is not used for a refund).                                                                       |

32.title: Create a Farmlands Authorisation
32.description: Once an approved authorisation has been provided, a full GST invoice must be submitted to Farmlands at vendor.invoices@farmlands.co.nz. The Short Code shown on the Approval screen must be copied and clearly displayed in the PO field of the invoice or where previously confirmed with the Farmlands Team. The Farmlands 9-digit Card number can be provided in addition to the Short Code in another field. Settlement will be completed as per agreed payment terms.

33.title: Invoicing & Settlement
33.description: Once an approved authorisation has been provided, a full GST invoice must be submitted to Farmlands at vendor.invoices@farmlands.co.nz. The Short Code shown on the Approval screen must be copied and clearly displayed in the PO field of the invoice or where previously confirmed with the Farmlands Team. The Farmlands 9-digit Card number can be provided in addition to the Short Code in another field. Settlement will be completed as per agreed payment terms.

34.title: Releasing Funds
34.description: The Authorised funds will be held against the Cardholder account for 31 days or until the invoice is received.  If the order is cancelled before the invoice is submitted to Farmlands the Authorisation should be released to remove the hold on Cardholder funds.

35.title: Release Hold on Customer Funds
35.description: The Payments page provides a list of transactions that were previously authorised. You can search by using the Authorisation Short Code as the reference. Further search functionality will be available at a later date.

36.title: Authorisation History
36.description: The Payments page provides a list of transactions that were previously authorised. You can search by using the Authorisation Short Code as the reference. Further search functionality will be available at a later date.

37.title: Setting a Default Merchant
37.description: Select your Default Merchant (First-time user) - The default merchant is the branch or outlet that the user normally works from, and which the transaction will be associated with.

38.title: Manage My Centrapay Business Account
38.description: The Account Owner has access to additional options to manage their Centrapay Business Account, including adding an removing users who have access to complete authorisations on their account.

39.title: Merchants
39.description: This area relates to the management of new and existing Branches/Locations used for Centrapay’s other payment types e.g tokens (i.e not Farmlands). Additional merchants added through the Merchants area will not be able to accept Farmlands Card until they are setup by Farmlands.

40.title: Bank Accounts
40.description: This function is only available to businesses who wish to use other Centrapay supported payment methods other than Farmlands Cards. (e.g. NZD).

41.title: Members
41.description: On the Members page you can manage the members connected to the Centrapay Business Account. An Account Owner can see the list of members and pending invitations and easily add or remove members.

42.title: Settings
42.description: On the Settings page, you can change your business information. Please note this does not flow through to Farmlands. If you have a change of ownership, please contact Farmlands.

43.title: FAQs
43.description: The Support button opens up a form that will allow you to send a support request directly to Centrapay if you have any issues regarding the Centrapay Business Portal.

44.title: Support
44.description: The Support button opens up a form that will allow you to send a support request directly to Centrapay if you have any issues regarding the Centrapay Business Portal.

45.title: Farmlands Card Partner Support Guide
45.description: How to for Farmlands Card Partners and Card Holders to request support from the relevant company and teams to get the help they need.

46.title: Support for Portal Users

61.title: Settlement Wallets
61.description: A Settlement Wallet is a special type of Wallet that can only receive or refund money related to a Payment Request. This means you cannot topup, withdraw, or send money from this Wallet.

| topup | Value of topups from bank accounts linked to the account.           |   Yes  | monthly yearly |

87.title: Get Account Quotas
87.description: Retrieve quota limits and usages for the current intervals. Ie, all quotas for the current day, current month and current year as well as any quotas that are not associated with a temporal period.

101.title: Update Profile
101.description: Update a user’s mutable attributes. At least one field must be provided in the request.

102.title: Get Profile
102.description:
This endpoint allows you to retrieve a user's Profile.
</Endpoint>

103.title: Payment Requests
103.description: Payment request models and related endpoints

104.title: Payment Request Model
104.description: ⭐️ For Payment Options which specify an address, there’s a requirement to make a transaction on an external ledger. Once you have made that payment, you can use the transaction id to Pay a Payment Request using the legacy payment API.

105.title: Payment Option Model
105.description: ⭐️ For Payment Options which specify an address, there’s a requirement to make a transaction on an external ledger. Once you have made that payment, you can use the transaction id to Pay a Payment Request using the legacy payment API.

106.title: Accepted Collections
106.description:
If a Payment Request contains a centrapay.token.* Payment Option, an array of Accepted Collections will be present inside the centrapay.token Payment Option.
The Accepted Collections returned can be used to determine if a Centrapay Token can be used to pay a Payment Request, and the Line Items able to be purchased using the Token.

107.title: Payment Condition Model
107.description:
Some Asset Types require conditional approval to pay. Possible Payment Conditions include confirming proof of ID
or confirming a promotional item was purchased.

108.title: Line Item Model
108.description:
An order item for which payment is requested.
The currency and units for a Line Item price will be consistent with the Payment Request value and the sum of Line Item prices should equal the Payment Request value.

109.title: Product Classification
109.description: The Paid By provides a summary of the transactions after the Payment Request was paid.

110.title: Paid By Model
110.description: The Paid By provides a summary of the transactions after the Payment Request was paid.

111.title: Asset Totals
111.description: The Asset Totals provides a sum of every transaction for each Asset Type

112.title: Payment Activity Model
112.description:
A Payment Activity records a transaction that has happened on a Payment Request.
Payment Activities are created when a Payment Request has been created, paid, refunded, cancelled, or expired.

113.title: Payment Activity Types
113.description:
|       Name        |                                                 Description                                                 |
| ----------------- | ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| request           | Payment Request was created.                                                      |
| preAuthRequest    | Payment Request was created with the preAuth flag set to "true".                |
| paid              | Payment Request was paid.                                                         |
| payment           | A payment was made towards the Payment Request.                                   |
| refund            | Funds were returned to the shopper.                                                                         |
| cancellation      | Payment Request was cancelled by the merchant or the shopper.                     |
| expiry            | Payment Request wasn't paid before time out.                                      |
| accept-condition  | A Payment Condition was accepted.                                               |
| decline-condition | A Payment Condition was declined.                                               |
| authorization     | A Pre Auth Payment Request was approved and confirmations can be made against it. |
| confirmation      | Funds on a Pre Auth have been drawn down on.                                                                |
| release           | Pre Auth has been finalised and any remaining funds from Authorization have been returned.                  |

114.title: Cancellation Reasons
114.description:
|            Reason            |                                                                                                     Description                                                                                                      |
| ---------------------------- | -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| CANCELLED_BY_MERCHANT        | The merchant cancelled the Payment Request by calling the cancel or void endpoint.                                                                                                                                   |
| CANCELLED_BY_PATRON          | The patron cancelled the transaction.                                                                                                                                                                                |
| PATRON_CODE_INVALID          | The patron code on the Payment Request was invalid.                                                                                                                                                                  |
| PAYMENT_FAILED               | The Payment Request failed for an unknown reason.                                                                                                                                                                    |
| PATRON_CODE_EXPIRED          | The patron code on the Payment Request has expired.                                                                                                                                                                  |
| DECLINED_BY_PATRON           | The payment was declined by the patron during approval steps.                                                                                                                                                        |
| DECLINED_BY_MERCHANT         | The payment was declined by the merchant during approval steps.                                                                                                                                                      |
| PAYMENT_DECLINED             | The payment parameters were valid but payment was declined because additional payment restrictions were violated. For example, asset not active, asset overdrawn, quota exceeded or line item category restrictions. |
| PAYMENT_REQUEST_EXPIRED      | The Payment Request has expired.                                                                                                                                                                                     |
| NO_AVAILABLE_PAYMENT_OPTIONS | No payment options match the requested payment parameters.                                                                                                                                                           |
| INACTIVE_ASSET               | The asset used to pay the Payment Request is inactive.                                                                                                                                                               |

115.title: Create a Payment Request
115.description: This endpoint allows you to create a Payment Request.

116.title: Get a Payment Request
116.description:
This endpoint allows you to retrieve a Payment Request.
</Endpoint>

117.title: Get a Payment Request by Short Code
117.description: This endpoint returns the latest Payment Request that matches the given short code.

118.title: Get a Payment Request linked to a Patron Code
118.description:
This endpoint returns the latest Payment Request with status new that has been attached to a Patron Code.
The Payment Request may have been created with a reference to any Patron Code owned by the user's
account.

119.title: List Payment Requests by External Reference
119.description:
This endpoint returns a list of Payment Requests that match the given external reference.
Results are paginated.

120.title: Get Payment Request Summary
120.description:
This endpoint allows you to retrieve the summary of a Payment Request while the status is new.
</Endpoint>

121.title: Pay a Payment Request
121.description: To pay a Payment Request you must supply the name of the Asset Type and one of assetId, transactionId or authorization.

122.title: Refund a Payment Request
122.description: This endpoint allows you to initiate a refund of a Payment Request. The refund will be completed asynchronously.

123.title: Void a Payment Request
123.description: Voiding a payment request will cancel the request and trigger any refunds if necessary.

124.title: Release Pre Auth funds
124.description: This endpoint allows you to release funds held for a Pre Auth Payment Request.

125.title: Confirm Pre Auth Payment Request
125.description: This endpoint allows you to make a confirmation against a Pre Auth Payment Request.

126.title: List Payment Activities for a Merchant
126.description:
This endpoint allows you to list Payment Activities for a Merchant.
Results are paginated and ordered by descending activity created date.

127.title: List Payment Activities for a Payment Request
127.description:
This endpoint allows you to list Payment Activities for a Payment Request.
Results are ordered by descending activity created date.
</Endpoint>

128.title: Accept a Payment Condition
128.description:
Accept a Payment Condition listed in merchantConditions with status awaiting-merchant.
Returns a Payment Activity.

129.title: Decline a Payment Condition
129.description:
Decline a Payment Condition listed in merchantConditions with status awaiting-merchant.
Returns a Payment Activity.

130.title: Patron Codes
130.description: Patron Code model and related endpoints

131.title: Patron Code Model
131.description:
✩ Barcode is a 16 digit number. The first 6 digits are a Centrapay defined prefix, then a 9 digit
code, then a luhn checksum digit.

132.title: Test Scenario Name
132.description:
This field is used to inject behavior into a Payment Request when the
generated barcode is supplied on creation. If a Test Scenario Name is
defined on a Patron Code, it is considered a test resource and can only
be used with Payment Requests that will have a liveness of 'test'. The Asset Type
centrapay.nzd.test is required to run test scenarios.

133.title: Create Patron Code
133.description:
This endpoint allows you to create a Patron Code. You can find payment request information attached to a Patron Code by polling for the Payment Request using the transacting APIs.
</Endpoint>

134.title: Get Patron Code
134.description:
This endpoint allows you to retrieve a Patron Code by id.
</Endpoint>

135.title: Get Patron Code By Barcode
135.description: This endpoint allows you to retrieve a Patron Code by barcode.

139.title: Format
139.description: Objects with prefixes will conform to the format {prefix}_{random-characters} e.g. mc_3LKQhvGUcADgqoEM3bh6pslE.

140.title: Prefix List
140.description:
| Prefix |                                Description                                 |
| ------ | -------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| mc_  | Identifier for a Merchant Config object.          |
| c_   | Identifier for a Collection object. |

142.title: Merchant Model
142.description:
|    Status    |                                                                Description                                                                 |                                      Allowed Reasons                                      |
| :----------- | :----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | :---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| applied      | Identifies merchants that have registered to be activated for the Centrapay service.                                                       |                                                                                           |
| provisioning | Identifies merchants that are in the process of being activated for the Centrapay service.                                                 |                                                                                           |
| active       | Identifies merchants that have been activated for Centrapay services successfully (i.e. they have successfully created a Payment Request). |                                                                                           |
| deactivated  | Identifies merchants that have been de-registered for the Centrapay service.                                                               | duplicate, data-quality-issues, no-response, change-of-ownership, centrapay-discontinued. |
| on-hold      | Identifies merchants that have been placed on hold.                                                                                        | seasonal-business-closure, incompatible-terminal, no-response                             |

143.title: Onboarding Statuses
143.description:
|    Status    |                                                                Description                                                                 |                                      Allowed Reasons                                      |
| :----------- | :----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | :---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| applied      | Identifies merchants that have registered to be activated for the Centrapay service.                                                       |                                                                                           |
| provisioning | Identifies merchants that are in the process of being activated for the Centrapay service.                                                 |                                                                                           |
| active       | Identifies merchants that have been activated for Centrapay services successfully (i.e. they have successfully created a Payment Request). |                                                                                           |
| deactivated  | Identifies merchants that have been de-registered for the Centrapay service.                                                               | duplicate, data-quality-issues, no-response, change-of-ownership, centrapay-discontinued. |
| on-hold      | Identifies merchants that have been placed on hold.                                                                                        | seasonal-business-closure, incompatible-terminal, no-response                             |

144.title: Onboarding Status Reasons
144.description:
|          Reason           |                           Description                            |
| :------------------------ | :--------------------------------------------------------------- |
| duplicate                 | The merchant already exists in the Centrapay system.             |
| data-quality-issues       | Data quality issues are preventing the merchant from onboarding. |
| no-response               | No response has been received from the merchant.                 |
| change-of-ownership       | The merchant has changed ownership.                              |
| centrapay-discontinued    | The merchant is no longer using Centrapay.                       |
| seasonal-business-closure | The merchant has closed temporarily.                             |
| incompatible-terminal     | The merchant does not have any compatible terminals.             |

187.title: Payment Request Model
187.description:
The "ledger" parameter indicates which payment option has been selected to pay
the payment request. The selected payment option must be one of the options
available for the payment request as per the payments array in the
requests.create and requests.info responses.

188.title: Payment Options Model
188.description:
The "ledger" parameter indicates which payment option has been selected to pay
the payment request. The selected payment option must be one of the options
available for the payment request as per the payments array in the
requests.create and requests.info responses.

189.title: Paid By Model
189.description:
The "ledger" parameter indicates which payment option has been selected to pay
the payment request. The selected payment option must be one of the options
available for the payment request as per the payments array in the
requests.create and requests.info responses.

190.title: Ledger and Authorization Values
190.description:
The "ledger" parameter indicates which payment option has been selected to pay
the payment request. The selected payment option must be one of the options
available for the payment request as per the payments array in the
requests.create and requests.info responses.

191.title: Create a Payment Request
191.description: This endpoint allows you to create a Payment Request.

192.title: Get a Payment Request
192.description: This endpoint allows you to receive Payment Request information.

193.title: Pay a Payment Request
193.description: This endpoint allows you to pay a Payment Request.

194.title: Cancel a Payment Request
194.description: This endpoint allows you to cancel a Payment Request.

195.title: Void a Payment Request
195.description: This endpoint allows you to void a Payment Request.

196.title: Refund a Transaction
196.description: Refunding a transaction can be done with or without an external reference.

197.title: Refund without external reference
197.description:
If you refund a transaction without providing an external reference, you
will get a successful response for the first request and then an
ALREADY_REFUNDED message for any refund requests that follow for the same
transaction, unless an external reference is provided.

198.title: Refund with external reference
198.description:
If you provide an external reference then a transaction can be refunded
multiple times provided that the external reference is unique for each
refund request. When a duplicate external reference is provided when
attempting to refund the same transaction we return a successful response if
the amount of the request is the same both times but do not process another
refund, this is because we assume it to be a repeat request. If the amount
is different you will get a REPEAT_REFERENCE error message.

199.title: Refund a Pre Auth Payment Request with Confirmations
199.description: The legacy refund endpoint cannot be used to refund Pre Auth Payment Requests with Confirmations. Please use the current refund endpoint instead.

201.title: Webhooks
201.description:
Webhook notifications are sent for significant Payment life-cycle
events. The Webhook endpoint is notified by sending an HTTP POST request to the
notifyUrl defined in the Payment Request.

202.title: Life-cycle Events That Trigger Webhooks
202.description:
The supported event types that will be notified to the Payment Requests webhook
and the associated "transactionType" value that will be sent in the payload
are:

203.title: Payment Request Cancelled
203.description:
A payment request can be cancelled by either calling the requests.cancel
or requests.void endpoint before a request has been paid successfully.
When a request has been cancelled we send a JWT that when decoded matches the
Payment Request Cancelled example in the Decoded Webhook JWT Examples
section below.

204.title: Payment Request Expired
204.description:
A payment request expires two minutes after being created if it hasn't been
cancelled, or paid. When a request has expired we send a JWT that when
decoded matches the Payment Request Cancelled example in the Decoded
Webhook JWT Examples section below with the transactionType set to EXPIRED.

205.title: Transaction Completed
205.description:
A transaction is considered complete when requests.pay is called with
parameters that satisfy a payment request and the request has been paid
successfully. When a transaction has been completed we send a JWT that when
decoded matches the Transaction Completed example in the Decoded Webhook
JWT Examples section below.

206.title: Transaction Refunded
206.description:
A transaction can be refunded one to many times and each time a transaction
has been refunded successfully we notify the webhook associated with the
original payment request. A transaction can be refunded when
transactions.refund has been called for a partial or full refund, or when
requests.void is called for a request that has been paid. When a
transaction has been refunded we send a JWT that when decoded matches the
Transaction Completed example in the Decoded Webhook JWT Examples section
below but with transactionType set to REFUND.

207.title: Webhook Payload
207.description: The body of the webhook is a JSON document with the following format:

208.title: Webhook Payload Fields
208.description:
| Property        | Description                                                 |
|:----------------|:------------------------------------------------------------|
| transactionId   | Id of the transaction                                       |
| transactionType | Indicates which event triggered the notification message    |
| state           | Current state of the transaction                            |
| ledger          | The ledger at which the authorization was processed         |
| amount          | Transaction amount in the lowest denomination available     |
| createdAt       | Timestamp at which the request was created                  |
| updatedAt       | Timestamp at which the request was updated                  |
| type            | The payment type used by the issuer to reconcile settlement |
| request         | Request object, see details at [requests.info][]            |
| authCode        | Authorization code used to settle this transaction          |

209.title: Webhook JWT Validation
209.description:
A webhook JWT can be validated by checking the signature against the Centrapay
Webhook public key:

214.title: Create Invitation

235.title: 200 Ok
235.description: Everything's ok. Enjoy your well formed response!

236.title: 400 Malformed Request
236.description:
This is a syntax failure. When you get these back, your application needs to change the way it
behaves in order to get back the resource that you're after.

237.title: Debugging
237.description: API key or JWT is missing, expired or invalid. Go look at our Auth documentation.

238.title: 401 Unauthorized
238.description: API key or JWT is missing, expired or invalid. Go look at our Auth documentation.

239.title: 403 Forbidden
239.description:
A 403 status indicates resource missing, permission denied or
business rule violation.

240.title: Resource missing or permission denied
240.description:
When the resource exists and access is authorized but some other business rule
is violated then a 403 is returned. Additional information will be included in
the "message" field of the response body. The possible values for the "message"
field will be documented on each endpoint.

241.title: Business rule violated
241.description:
When the resource exists and access is authorized but some other business rule
is violated then a 403 is returned. Additional information will be included in
the "message" field of the response body. The possible values for the "message"
field will be documented on each endpoint.

242.title: 404 Route Not Found
242.description:
Variant on a 400, there's a bug in your code that means you've got a typo in
the URL or HTTP method. Please check against examples in our documentation.

243.title: 429 Too Many Requests
243.description: Centrapay API rate limits have been exceeded.

244.title: Debugging
244.description:
If you get a 500 level error, something has gone wrong on our end. Retrying
should solve the issue. Usually a Centrapay Engineer will investigate but
bug reports are also welcome at integrations@centrapay.com.

245.title: 5xx Server Error
245.description:
If you get a 500 level error, something has gone wrong on our end. Retrying
should solve the issue. Usually a Centrapay Engineer will investigate but
bug reports are also welcome at integrations@centrapay.com.

253.title: Abort Funds Transfer
253.description: This endpoint allows you to abort a Funds Transfer.

255.title: Create Event
255.description: This endpoint allows you to create an  Event .

257.title: Timestamp
257.description:
A point in time, usually with millisecond precision, represented as an
ISO 8601 date string (eg "2021-06-11T02:51:11.000Z"). Timestamps
are in the UTC timezone as denoted by the "Z" suffix.

258.title: BigNumber
258.description:
A number, represented as a String, which can have arbitrary size or precision.
Most Centrapay APIs that deal with transactable value (ie. assets, payments,
etc) represent the value as BigNumbers. Depending on the context, a BigNumber
may be used to represent an integer or a decimal amount.

259.title: Monetary
259.description:
A monetary amount in a currency, represented as an Object. The amount is
usually an integer in the smallest denomination for the currency (ie cents) but
may be a decimal value for some currencies (eg Bitcoin). The currency is
typically represented as an ISO 4217 code.

260.title: Fields
260.description:
|   Name   |          Type           |                        Description                         |
| -------- | ----------------------- | ---------------------------------------------------------- |
| amount   | BigNumber | Value in the currency's smallest denomination (eg. cents). |
| currency | String                  | Currency code (eg. "NZD").                                 |

261.title: CRN
261.description:
A Centrapay Resource Name (CRN) is a colon-delimited String that uniquely
identifies any Centrapay resource.

262.title: Location
262.description:
A location's represented as an Object with properties to denote the location both absolute and
by locality.

263.title: Required Fields
263.description:
|  Name   |  Type  |                                      Description                                       |
| ------- | ------ | -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| street  | String | Unit, number, and name of street address.                                              |
| city    | String | City of location.                                                                      |
| country | String | ISO 3166 Country code. (eg. "NZ"). |

264.title: Optional Fields
264.description:
|   Name   |  Type  |                                                  Description                                                  |
| -------- | ------ | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| lat      | Number | Absolute latitude coordinate. If you don't provide this, we will automatically infer this from your address.  |
| lng      | Number | Absolute longitude coordinate. If you don't provide this, we will automatically infer this from your address. |
| suburb   | String | Suburb of location.                                                                                           |
| postCode | String | Post or Zip code of location.                                                                                 |
| state    | String | The state or region of the location (eg. "Auckland").                                                         |

265.title: PhoneNumber
265.description: A phone number, represented in E.123 international notation (eg "+6421537663"). We usually use this for receiving text messages.

266.title: PAN
266.description: The Primary Account Number (PAN) of a payment card. Used for eCommerce payments.

267.title: Centrapay Event Types
267.description: Event types that Centrapay uses internally

269.title: Business Model
269.description:
|    Status    |                                                                 Description                                                                 |                                   Allowed Reasons                                   |
| :----------- | :------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ | :---------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| applied      | Identifies businesses that have registered to be activated for the Centrapay service.                                                       |                                                                                     |
| provisioning | Identifies businesses that are in the process of being activated for the Centrapay service.                                                 |                                                                                     |
| active       | Identifies businesses that have been activated for Centrapay services successfully (i.e. they have successfully created a Payment Request). |                                                                                     |
| deactivated  | Identifies businesses that have been de-registered for the Centrapay service.                                                               | data-quality-issues,change-of-ownership, centrapay-discontinued, duplicate, blocked |
| on-hold      | Identifies businesses that have been placed on hold.                                                                                        | seasonal-business-closure,  no-response                                             |

270.title: Onboarding Statuses
270.description:
|    Status    |                                                                 Description                                                                 |                                   Allowed Reasons                                   |
| :----------- | :------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ | :---------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| applied      | Identifies businesses that have registered to be activated for the Centrapay service.                                                       |                                                                                     |
| provisioning | Identifies businesses that are in the process of being activated for the Centrapay service.                                                 |                                                                                     |
| active       | Identifies businesses that have been activated for Centrapay services successfully (i.e. they have successfully created a Payment Request). |                                                                                     |
| deactivated  | Identifies businesses that have been de-registered for the Centrapay service.                                                               | data-quality-issues,change-of-ownership, centrapay-discontinued, duplicate, blocked |
| on-hold      | Identifies businesses that have been placed on hold.                                                                                        | seasonal-business-closure,  no-response                                             |

271.title: Onboarding Status Reasons
271.description:
|          Reason           |                           Description                            |
| :------------------------ | :--------------------------------------------------------------- |
| duplicate                 | The business already exists in the Centrapay system.             |
| data-quality-issues       | Data quality issues are preventing the business from onboarding. |
| no-response               | No response has been received from the business.                 |
| change-of-ownership       | The business has changed ownership.                              |
| centrapay-discontinued    | The business is no longer using Centrapay.                       |
| seasonal-business-closure | The business has closed temporarily.                             |

289.title: Direct Debit Authority Model
289.description:
A direct-debit authority is required to be able to Top Up a Bank Account. By including
directDebitAuthority, the user accepts our Direct Debit terms
and has authority to operate this account.

290.title: Bank Account Approval Type Summary Model
290.description:
A summary of the Bank Account Approvals for a Bank Account.
There is one object per type of Bank Account Approval, which provides a summary of the approval status.

291.title: Bank Account Balance Model
291.description: The Bank Account balance, retrieved using Open Banking flows. The supported Bank Account type is quartz.

292.title: Create Bank Account
292.description:
A Bank Account can be created with or without direct debit authorized.  By including
directDebitAuthority, the user accepts our Direct Debit terms
and has authority to operate this account.

293.title: Add Direct Debit Authority to a Bank Account
293.description: By using this endpoint, the user accepts our Direct Debit terms and has authority to operate this account.

294.title: Get Bank Account
294.description:
This endpoint allows you to retrieve information about a Bank Account.
</Endpoint>

295.title: Get Bank Account Balance
295.description: This endpoint allows you to retrieve the balance of a Bank Account.

296.title: Verify Bank Account
296.description: Verification codes show up on statements when a user makes withdrawals and deposits. To verify an account, you need to direct the user to make a Top Up or Withdrawal and then check their statement.

297.title: List Bank Accounts
297.description:
This endpoint allows you to list the Bank Accounts for an account.
</Endpoint>

299.title: Archive Bank Account
299.description: Archives the supplied bank account. This endpoint is currently only supported for quartz bank accounts.

300.title: Verify Bank Authority
300.description: If you're creating new interfaces, please work with Verify Bank Account.

301.title: List Bank Authorities
301.description:
If you're creating new interfaces, please work with List Bank Accounts.
</Endpoint>

302.title: Create Bank Authority
302.description: If you're creating new interfaces, please work with Create Bank Account.

303.title: Get Bank Authority

| :-------------------------- | :------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| account-information-consent | Initiates an authorization flow for authorizing access to bank account details. After a Bank Account Connection Intent has been authorized, one or more Centrapay Bank Account resources may be created. |

309.title: Bank Account Approvals
309.description: Bank Account Approval model and related endpoints

310.title: Bank Account Approval Model
310.description:
|      Name                    |                                                                                                                                      description                                                                                                                                      |
| :--------------------------- | :------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ |
| settlement                   | An approved Bank Account Approval of type settlement is required for the funds in a Settlement Wallet to be released. A Media Upload is uploaded by the user to provide evidence of ownership of the Bank Account to be approved. |
| account-information-consent  | An approved Bank Account Approval of type account-information-consent provides an access token to read account details from a third-party.                                                                                                                                                    |
| enduring-payment-consent     | An approved Bank Account Approval of type enduring-payment-consent provides an access token for creating payments with a third-party.                                                                                                                                                      |

311.title: Bank Account Approval Types
311.description:
|      Name                    |                                                                                                                                      description                                                                                                                                      |
| :--------------------------- | :------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ |
| settlement                   | An approved Bank Account Approval of type settlement is required for the funds in a Settlement Wallet to be released. A Media Upload is uploaded by the user to provide evidence of ownership of the Bank Account to be approved. |
| account-information-consent  | An approved Bank Account Approval of type account-information-consent provides an access token to read account details from a third-party.                                                                                                                                                    |
| enduring-payment-consent     | An approved Bank Account Approval of type enduring-payment-consent provides an access token for creating payments with a third-party.                                                                                                                                                      |

319.title: Authenticating API Calls
319.description:
API calls can be authenticated by either providing an API key in the
"X-Api-Key" header or by providing a user access token in the "Authorization"
header.

320.title: API Keys
320.description: API Keys provide enduring access to a single Centrapay account.

321.title: User Access Tokens
321.description:
User access tokens provide time-limited access to all Centrapay accounts for
which the user is a member. Access tokens are issued using OIDC code flow via
the Centrapay OAuth authorization server and login page at auth.centrapay.com.

322.title: Claims
322.description:
The following table lists the claims which may be be included in a user id token.
At minimum, the "sub" claim and one of "phone_number" or "email" will be present.

323.title: Roles and Permissions
323.description:
Users and API keys are assigned a role for their associated Centrapay
account(s). The permissions granted to the roles are shown in the table below.

324.title: Account Flags
324.description:
Some permissions require an additional flag associated to their individual account or the
targeted account that owns the resource (they may be the same account). For each permission,
if there is a flag associated to it then at least one of them must be met.

325.title: Permissions
325.description:
|             Permission             | Account Owner | Anon Consumer | Merchant Terminal | External Asset Provider | Cashier |
| ---------------------------------- | ------------- | ------------- | ----------------- | ----------------------- | ------- |
| accounts:create                    | ✅             |               |                   |                         |         |
| accounts:read                      | ✅             |               |                   | ✅                       | ✅       |
| accounts:update                    | ✅             |               |                   |                         |         |
| api-keys:create                    | ✅             |               |                   |                         |         |
| api-keys:list                      | ✅             |               |                   |                         |         |
| api-keys:update                    | ✅             |               |                   |                         |         |
| asset-transfers:claim              | ✅             |               |                   | ✅                       |         |
| asset-transfers:create 👤 🧀         | ✅             |               |                   | ✅                       |         |
| asset-transfers:read               | ✅             |               |                   | ✅                       |         |
| assets:read                        | ✅             |               |                   | ✅                       |         |
| assets:spend 👤                     | ✅             |               |                   |                         |         |
| bank-account-approvals:create      | ✅             |               |                   |                         |         |
| bank-account-requests:authorize    | ✅             |               |                   |                         |         |
| bank-account-requests:create       | ✅             |               |                   |                         |         |
| bank-accounts:create               | ✅             |               |                   |                         |         |
| bank-accounts:read                 | ✅             |               |                   |                         |         |
| bank-accounts:update               | ✅             |               |                   |                         |         |
| business:create                    | ✅             |               |                   |                         |         |
| business:update                    | ✅             |               |                   |                         |         |
| business:read                      | ✅             |               |                   |                         |         |
| collections:create 🪙               | ✅             |               |                   |                         |         |
| collections:read 🪙                 | ✅             |               |                   |                         |         |
| events:create                      | ✅             |               |                   |                         |         |
| external-assets:create 👤 🧀         | ✅             |               |                   | ✅                       |         |
| external-assets:update             | ✅             |               |                   | ✅                       |         |
| integration-requests:configure     |               |               |                   |                         |         |
| integration-requests:create 🗄      | ✅             |               |                   |                         |         |
| integration-requests:read 🗄        | ✅             |               |                   |                         |         |
| invitations:accept                 | ✅ ✸           |               |                   |                         |         |
| invitations:read                   | ✅ ✸           |               |                   |                         |         |
| media-uploads:create               | ✅             |               |                   |                         |         |
| memberships:delete 🗄               | ✅             |               |                   |                         |         |
| memberships:update                 | ✅             |               |                   |                         |         |
| merchants:create 🗄                 | ✅             |               |                   |                         |         |
| merchants:list 🗄                   | ✅             |               |                   |                         | ✅       |
| merchants:read 🗄                   | ✅             |               |                   |                         | ✅       |
| merchants:update 🗄                 | ✅             |               |                   |                         |         |
| loyalty-programs:create 🗄          | ✅             |               |                   |                         |         |
| loyalty-programs:read 🗄            | ✅             |               |                   |                         |         |
| patron-codes:create                | ✅             |               |                   |                         |         |
| patron-codes:read                  | ✅             |               | ✅                 |                         | ✅       |
| payment-activities:read            | ✅             |               | ✅                 |                         | ✅       |
| payment-conditions:approve         | ✅             |               | ✅                 |                         | ✅       |
| payment-requests:cancel 🗄          | ✅             |               | ✅                 |                         | ✅       |
| payment-requests:create 🗄          | ✅             |               | ✅ ✸               |                         | ✅       |
| payment-requests:pay 🗄             | ✅ ✸           | ✅ ✸           | ✅                 |                         | ✅ ✸     |
| payment-requests:read              | ✅ ✸           | ✅ ✸           | ✅ ✸               |                         | ✅ ✸     |
| payment-requests:read-by-shortcode | ✅             |               | ✅                 |                         | ✅       |
| payment-requests:refund 🗄          | ✅             |               | ✅                 |                         | ✅       |
| payment-requests:void 🗄            | ✅             |               | ✅                 |                         | ✅       |
| payment-requests:release 🗄         | ✅             |               | ✅                 |                         | ✅       |
| payment-requests:confirm 🗄         | ✅             |               | ✅                 |                         | ✅       |
| quotas:read                        | ✅             |               |                   |                         |         |
| redemption-conditions:create 🪙     | ✅             |               |                   |                         |         |
| redemption-conditions:update 🪙     | ✅             |               |                   |                         |         |
| scanned-code:decode                | ✅             |               | ✅                 |                         | ✅       |
| tokens:create 🪙                    | ✅             |               |                   |                         |         |
| topups:read                        | ✅             |               |                   |                         |         |

| wallets:deposit                    | ✅             |               |                   |                         |         |
| wallets:read                       | ✅             |               |                   |                         |         |

| wallets:withdraw                   | ✅             |               |                   |                         |         |

327.title: Asset Model
327.description:
All assets have the following fields along with the additional fields that are
specific to its category. Assets which don't have a category are considered <Badge type="experimental" />
and the model may change.

328.title: Money Model
328.description:
Money assets, being backed by real currency, are the most flexible asset types.
Money is accepted for most payment requests, can be sent in arbitrary amounts
and does not expire.

329.title: Token Model
329.description: Tokens are assets which can only be spent in full. Every token is associated with a collection, which defines the branding and general rules for the tokens, such as active duration.

330.title: Ledger Model
330.description: A ledger is a single asset that maintains a balance of multiple tokens belonging to an account. All tokens in a ledger come from a specific collection. Multiple tokens can be spent or sent at once from the ledger.

333.title: List Assets for Account
333.description: Returns a paginated list of Assets for an account. This will not return archived assets.

334.title: Archive Asset
334.description: Archive supported asset types by asset id. Currently tokens, and quartz.nzd assets may be archived.

338.title: Asset Transfers
338.description: Asset transfer lifecycle and related endpoints

339.title: Asset Transfer Model
339.description: Asset Transfer goes through different lifecycle stages.

340.title: Asset Transfer lifecycle
340.description: Asset Transfer goes through different lifecycle stages.

341.title: Request an Asset Transfer
341.description: Request a transfer of an asset from a sender to the recipient.

343.title: Create an Asset Transfer
343.description:
Transfer an asset to a recipient. Some assets can be transfered only in whole
(eg tokens) while others can be transfered only in part (eg money).

346.title: Claim Asset Transfer
346.description: Claim the asset transfer for the caller's authorised account.

347.title: Resolve Claimable Assets
347.description:
When you send another centrapay user cash or assets, they're automatically assigned to them.
However, if they're not signed up yet then these assets are not immediately assigned.

348.title: List Asset Transfers
348.description: Returns a paginated list of Asset Transfers.

350.title: Asset Activities
350.description: Asset Activity models and related endpoints

351.title: Asset Activity Model
351.description: All Asset Activities extend this base model. This contains all properties that are shared between the activities

352.title: Asset Transaction Activity Model
352.description:
The destParty and srcParty are optionally provided only on transactions of
type transfer. Values may include a merchant name, user handle, masked user
email, masked user phone, or bank account.

353.title: Token Refunded Activity Model
353.description: This records the refunding of a token. Used when activityType is token. This extends the Asset Activity Model

354.title: Token Redeemed Activity Model
354.description: This records the redeeming of a token. Used when activityType is token-redeemed. This extends the Asset Activity Model

355.title: Asset Created Activity Model
355.description: This records the creation of an asset. Used when activityType is created. This extends the Asset Activity Model

356.title: Asset Received Activity Model
356.description: This records the receiving of an asset. Used when activityType is received. This extends the Asset Activity Model

357.title: Asset Sent Activity Model
357.description: This records the sending of an asset. Used when activityType is sent. This extends the Asset Activity Model

358.title: Asset Activity Types
358.description:
|       Name              |                                                 Description                                                                   |
| ----------------------- | ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| token                   | Token was refunded. Uses Token refunded Model                    |
| value-in                | Asset value has been increased. Uses Asset Transaction Model  |
| value-out               | Asset value has been decreased. Uses Asset Transaction Model  |
| archive-asset           | Asset was archived. Uses Asset Activity Model                             |
| activate-asset          | Asset was activated. Uses Asset Activity Model                            |
| disable-asset           | Asset was activated. Uses Asset Activity Model                            |
| token-redeemed          | Token was redeemed. Uses Token Redeemed Model                    |
| created                 | Asset was created. Uses Asset Created Model                       |
| received                | Asset was received. Uses Asset Received Model                    |
| sent                    | Asset was sent. Uses Asset Sent Model                                |

359.title: List Asset Transactions
359.description:
Returns a paginated list of Asset Transactions. This endpoint is currently only supported for quartz asset types.
</Endpoint>

360.title: List Asset Activities
360.description: Returns a paginated list of Asset Activities.

364.title: Create an API Key
364.description: This endpoint allows you to create an API key.

365.title: List API Keys
365.description:
This endpoint allows you to list all API Keys for an Account.
</Endpoint>

366.title: Update an API Key
366.description: This endpoint allows you to enable or disable an API key.

370.title: Create an Account
370.description: This endpoint allows you to create an Account.

371.title: Get an Account
371.description:
This endpoint allows you to retrieve an Account.
</Endpoint>

372.title: Update an Account
372.description: This endpoint allows you to update an account.

373.title: Update Subscriptions
373.description: This endpoint allows you to update the subscriptions on an account.

374.title: Account Memberships
374.description: Account Memberships model and related endpoints

375.title: Account Membership Model
375.description: A Member contains extended information about a user's access to an account.

376.title: Add Member
376.description: This endpoint allows you to add or update the membership of a user to an account.

377.title: List members
377.description:
This endpoint allows you to retrieve the list memberships to an account.
</Endpoint>

378.title: Revoke Member
378.description: This endpoint allows you to revoke a users membership to an account.

379.title: List Account Memberships for Authenticated Subject
379.description:
This endpoint allows you to retrieve the accounts that the authenticated subject is a member of.
</Endpoint>

380.title: List Account Memberships for a User
380.description:
This endpoint allows you to retrieve the accounts that a user is a member of.
</Endpoint>

382.title: Terminal Status
382.description: A complete batch example with all batch types included. For more legible examples please refer to Example Models.

383.title: Example JSONL File
383.description: A complete batch example with all batch types included. For more legible examples please refer to Example Models.

389.title: Account Model
389.description: Exported Farmlands Account used for importing and updating of a Centrapay Asset.

390.title: Contact Model
390.description: Exported Farmlands Contact and Card information used for authentication, correspondence and payment.

391.title: Card Model
391.description: Exported Farmlands Credit Card information used for importing and updating of a Patron Code.

392.title: Example JSONL File
392.description: A complete batch example with all batch types included. For more legible examples please refer to Example Models.

393.title: Example Models
393.description: Centrapay matches previously created resources using externalId and records get created or updated based on these IDs. In some cases, fields may be omitted to only update some fields.
